company_overview.description: Connect by Circular-Lab specializes in extracting, digitizing, integrating, and ensuring the traceability of clinical diagnostics and health data for full interoperability. They address the challenge of non-standardized diagnostic data by providing a cloud platform that captures, standardizes, and visualizes this data, enabling seamless integration and downstream utilization.

company_overview.description: Whering is a fashion technology startup based in the UK that aims to revolutionize the way consumers interact with their wardrobes and the fashion industry at large. They offer a B2C app that allows users to digitize their wardrobe, receive AI-driven styling recommendations, and facilitate resale of clothing items. Their B2B offering aims to provide retailers with better personalization capabilities.

main_products.name: Whering App (B2C)
main_products.description: A mobile application that allows users to digitize their wardrobe by uploading photos of their clothing items. The app utilizes AI to automatically tag and categorize items. It provides outfit suggestions based on the user's wardrobe and preferences, offers usage insights, and facilitates resale of clothing.

Integration with retailers for smarter purchasing decisions

Whering addresses both wardrobe management, styling, and resale, tapping into both markets.

company_overview.description: Hybr is a B2B2C platform that streamlines the student lettings process for landlords and agents while helping students and graduates find suitable housing. It automates listing management, tenant vetting, and viewing scheduling, saving time and resources for letting teams. The platform also aims to reduce university dropout rates by addressing housing instability among first-time renters.

AI-driven analysis: Automates and improves the accuracy of drug response assessment.

company_overview.description: Noxon is a German startup developing a wearable Muscle-Computer Interface (MCI) to provide personalized treatments for musculoskeletal and neuromuscular conditions. Their technology combines neuromuscular electrical stimulation (NMES), electromyography (EMG), and artificial intelligence to help patients regain muscle function and improve muscle health. They target conditions like Parkinson's disease and muscle atrophy.
